page.title: 02Cowbridge Half Marathon
page.content: It was a breezy morning on Sunday 12th May, the day of the Cowbridge Fire Station Half Marathon. The runners assembled outside the Cowbridge fire station for the start at 10:00am. The 500 runners made quite a spectacle as they moved off towards Eastgate and on to the St.Athan Road. As they went on to the St.Athan Road the steepest hill on the course loomed up ahead of them. Meanwhile the streets of Cowbridge became lined with people eager to welcome the first runner home. An hour and ten minutes later their patience was rewarded as Ian Beard of Abertillary crossed the line. The first woman to finish was Veronica Singleton from the Les Croupiers Club in Cardiff, and her time was 1hr 27mins. As everyone crossed the line they received a medal and certificate. { Gillian Manning, Matthew Herbert
